paper_001.title: Common risk factors in the returns on stocks and bonds
paper_001.authors: Fama, Eugene F.; French, Kenneth R.
paper_001.abstract: This paper identifies five common risk factors in the returns on stocks and bonds. There are three stock-market factors: an overall market factor and factors related to firm size and book-to-market equity. There are two bond-market factors, related to maturity and default risks.
paper_001.notes: Seminal paper introducing the three-factor model (Market, Size, Value). Forms the foundation for modern factor investing research. The SMB (Small Minus Big) and HML (High Minus Low) factors have become standard in asset pricing.

paper_002.title: On Persistence in Mutual Fund Performance
paper_002.abstract: This paper examines the consistency and sources of mutual fund performance. The four-factor model that includes momentum (UMD) largely explains persistence in returns.
paper_002.notes: Extended Fama-French three-factor model by adding momentum factor (UMD). The Carhart four-factor model became a standard benchmark for performance evaluation.

paper_003.title: A five-factor asset pricing model
paper_003.authors: Fama, Eugene F.; French, Kenneth R.
paper_003.abstract: A five-factor model directed at capturing the size, value, profitability, and investment patterns in average stock returns performs better than the three-factor model.
paper_003.notes: Extended the three-factor model to five factors by adding profitability (RMW) and investment (CMA) factors.

paper_004.title: The other side of value: The gross profitability premium
paper_004.abstract: Profitability, measured by gross profits-to-assets, has roughly the same power as book-to-market predicting the cross-section of average returns.
paper_004.notes: Introduced gross profitability as a powerful predictor of stock returns. Influenced the development of the Fama-French five-factor model.

paper_005.title: Digesting anomalies: An investment approach
paper_005.authors: Hou, Kewei; Xue, Chen; Zhang, Lu
paper_005.abstract: We develop the q-factor model using market, size, investment, and profitability factors. The q-factor model largely summarizes the cross-section of average stock returns.
paper_005.notes: Introduced the q-factor model based on investment theory. Uses four factors: Market, Size (ME), Investment (I/A), and Profitability (ROE).

paper_006.title: Value and Momentum Everywhere
paper_006.authors: Asness, Clifford S.; Moskowitz, Tobias J.; Pedersen, Lasse Heje
paper_006.abstract: We find consistent value and momentum return premia across eight diverse markets and asset classes. Value and momentum are negatively correlated with each other.
paper_006.notes: Demonstrates that value and momentum factors exist across multiple asset classes and geographic markets.

paper_007.title: Quality Minus Junk
paper_007.authors: Asness, Clifford S.; Frazzini, Andrea; Pedersen, Lasse Heje
paper_007.abstract: We define a quality security as one that is safe, profitable, growing, and well managed. High-quality stocks outperform low-quality stocks on a risk-adjusted basis globally.
paper_007.notes: Introduced a comprehensive quality factor (QMJ) combining profitability, growth, safety, and payout characteristics.

paper_008.title: Factor Momentum and the Momentum Factor
paper_008.abstract: Momentum in individual stock returns emanates from momentum in factor returns. Most factors are positively autocorrelated: the average factor earns a monthly return of 1 basis point following a year of losses and 53 basis points following a positive year. Factor momentum explains all forms of individual stock momentum. Stock momentum strategies indirectly time factors: they profit when the factors remain autocorrelated, and crash when these autocorrelations break down. Our key result is that momentum is not a distinct risk factor; it aggregates the autocorrelations found in all other factors.
paper_008.notes: NBER Working Paper No. 25551. 本文提出 Factor Momentum 概念，認為動量效應來自於因子報酬的自相關性，而非獨立的風險因子。研究涵蓋 20 個因子，發現平均因子在正報酬年度後月報酬 52bp，負報酬年度後僅 2bp。Keywords: factor momentum, momentum factor, autocorrelation, factor returns, time-series momentum.

paper_009.title: The Volatility Effect Revisited
paper_009.authors: Blitz, David; van Vliet, Pim; Baltussen, Guido
paper_009.abstract: High-risk stocks do not have higher returns than low-risk stocks in all major stock markets. This paper provides a comprehensive overview of this low-risk effect, from the earliest asset pricing studies in the nineteen seventies to the most recent empirical findings and interpretations since. Volatility appears to be the main driver of the anomaly, which is highly persistent over time and across markets, and which cannot be explained by other factors such as value, profitability, or exposure to interest rate changes. From a practical perspective we argue that low-risk investing requires little turnover, that volatilities are more important than correlations, that low-risk indices are suboptimal and vulnerable to overcrowding, and that other factors can be efficiently integrated into a low-risk strategy. Finally, we find little evidence that the low-risk effect is being arbitraged away, as many investors are either neutrally positioned, or even on the other side of the low-risk trade.
paper_009.notes: Robeco 研究團隊的低波動效應綜述論文。核心發現：高風險股票並未獲得更高報酬，低波動異常持續存在且跨市場穩定，無法被 value、profitability 等因子解釋。JEL: G11, G12, G14。Keywords: low risk, low volatility, low beta, minimum variance, anomaly, factor investing, smart beta.

paper_010.title: The Volatility Effect: Lower Risk without Lower Return
paper_010.authors: Blitz, David C.; van Vliet, Pim
paper_010.abstract: Stocks with low volatility earn high risk-adjusted returns. The annual alpha spread of global low versus high volatility decile portfolios amounts to 12% over the 1986-2006 period. The volatility effect is observed within the US, European and Japanese markets, and cannot be explained by value and size effects.
paper_010.notes: 低波動異常效應的原始論文（2007）。核心發現：低波動股票獲得更高的風險調整報酬，全球低波動 vs 高波動十分位投資組合年化 alpha 差距達 12%。此效應在美國、歐洲、日本市場皆存在，且無法被 value 和 size 因子解釋。此研究為 Robeco 低波動策略的學術基礎，paper_009 (2019) 為其後續更新版本。
